data.name: Crazy Waiter
data.description:
You work in a restaurant, and the waiter has decided to take orders in an unusual fashion - one dish at a time. Write a function that will sort the individual orders into their respective tables (and also calculate the table's total bill).

You will be passed an array of objects, with each object representing a single dish:

``` javascript
let orders = [{
  table: 1,
  dish: "tomato salad",
  when: "starter",
  price: 4
},
{
  table: 1,
  dish: "mackerel",
  when: "starter",
  price: 5
},
{
  table: 3,
  dish: "beef burger",
  when: "main",
  price: 8
},
{
  table: 2,
  dish: "ham pizza",
  when: "main",
  price: 9
},
{
  table: 2,
  dish: "lemon pie",
  when: "dessert",
  price: 5
},
{
  table: 1,
  dish: "chocolate brownie",
  when: "dessert",
  price: 5
},
{
  table: 2,
  dish: "veggie burger",
  when: "main",
  price: 8
},
{
  table: 1,
  dish: "cottage pie",
  when: "main",
  price: 8
},
{
  table: 3,
  dish: "smoked salmon",
  when: "starter",
  price: 6
},
{
  table: 2,
  dish: "tomato salad",
  when: "starter",
  price: 4
}]
```

The ```when ``` key will only ever have a value of either ```"starter" ```, ``` "main" ``` or ```"dessert" ```.
Your job is to process all the orders and return them as an ordered, nested object, with the first level of objects representing tables:

``` javascript
     {
      1: 
        { starters: [ 'tomato salad', 'mackerel' ],
          mains: [ 'cottage pie' ],
          desserts: [ 'chocolate brownie' ],
          bill: 22 },
      2: 
        { starters: [ 'tomato salad' ],
          mains: [ 'ham pizza', 'veggie burger' ],
          desserts: [ 'lemon pie' ],
          bill: 26 },
      3: 
        { starters: [ 'smoked salmon' ],
          mains: [ 'beef burger' ],
          desserts: [],
          bill: 14 } 
       }
```

You should accumulate the total bill and include this at the end of the table object. For the ```starters```, ```mains``` and ```desserts``` keys, the value will always be an array. If a table has not received any values for a particular key - i.e, no desserts - then simply leave an empty array.
